item.title: 特朗普官员称印尼将在美国贸易协议中削减关税和非关税壁垒
item.description: 7月22日（路透社）--特朗普政府的一位高级官员周二表示，印尼将对其与美国99%以上的贸易产品降税至零，同时还将取消对美国商品的所有非关税壁垒，这项协议将把美国可能对印尼产品征收的关税从最初的32%降至19%。【原文：July 22 (Reuters) - Indonesia will drop tariffs to zero on more than 99% of its trade with the United States and will also eliminate all non-tariff barriers for American goods in a deal that cuts threatened U.S. tariffs on Indonesian products to 19% from an initial 32%, a senior Trump administration official said on Tuesday.】

item.title: ASM 第二季度预订业绩令人失望，原因是订单时机不对
item.description: 周二，计算机芯片设备制造商 ASM International 公布的第二季度预订额低于市场预期，原因是来自生产先进芯片的芯片制造商的订单时间不均衡。【原文：Computer chip equipment maker ASM International reported second-quarter bookings below market expectations on Tuesday, citing uneven order timing from chipmakers making advanced chips.】

item.title: 美联储官员和银行业专家在会议上讨论监管重写工作
item.description: 周二，美联储在其总部召开了为期一天的会议，继续开展重写银行规则的全面工作。【原文：The Federal Reserve continued work on its comprehensive effort to rewrite bank rules with a daylong conference at its headquarters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 参议员沃伦警告纽约银行与北方信托的潜在合并可能违反联邦银行法
item.description: 参议员伊丽莎白-沃伦（Elizabeth Warren）警告纽约银行说，据报道，纽约银行有意与北方信托合并，这可能违反联邦银行法，并称这两家大型托管银行之间的任何潜在交易都会引发反垄断问题。【原文：Senator Elizabeth Warren has warned BNY that its reported interest in a merger with Northern Trust could violate federal banking laws, saying any potential deal between the two large custody banks raises antitrust concerns.】

item.title: 由于可可成本高昂，好时将提高巧克力价格
item.description: 好时（Hershey）周二表示，由于其产品的主要成分可可的成本激增，该公司已通知零售商将提高糖果价格。【原文：Hershey said on Tuesday it has told retailers that it would be raising prices on its candies due to a surge in costs of cocoa, the key ingredient for its products.】

item.title: 美国审计监督机构禁止并罚款香港审计师
item.description: 美国上市公司会计监督委员会周二表示，它已吊销了一家香港事务所的执照，并禁止其所有人进入，原因是该事务所违反了与在中国运营的公司有关的审计规定，其中包括乐金咖啡公司。【原文：The U.S. Public Company Accounting Oversight Board said on Tuesday it had revoked the license of a Hong Kong firm and barred its owner for violating audit rules related to companies operating in China, including Luckin Coffee Inc.】

item.title: 诉讼称 Clorox 黑客通过询问获取密码
item.description: 漂白剂制造商高乐氏（Clorox）周二表示，该公司已就 2023 年的一次破坏性网络攻击起诉信息技术供应商 Cognizant，指控黑客仅通过向该技术公司员工索要员工密码就完成了入侵。【原文：Bleach maker Clorox said Tuesday that it has sued information technology provider Cognizant over a devastating 2023 cyberattack, alleging that the hackers pulled off the intrusion simply by asking the tech company's staff for employees' passwords.】

item.title: 彭博社报道：SpaceX 警告投资者埃隆-马斯克可能重返美国政坛
item.description: 彭博新闻社周二援引太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）的文件和熟悉相关内容的人士的话报道称，曾担任唐纳德-特朗普总统高级顾问的埃隆-马斯克可能会重返美国政坛。【原文：Elon Musk, who served as a senior adviser to President Donald Trump, may return to U.S. politics, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing SpaceX documents and people familiar with the content.】

item.title: 特朗普称派拉蒙诉讼和解后收到 1600 万美元付款
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，作为诉讼和解的一部分，哥伦比亚广播公司的母公司派拉蒙公司周二支付了 1600 万美元，他预计还将收到 2000 万美元。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said CBS parent company Paramount paid $16 million on Tuesday as part of a lawsuit settlement and that he expects to receive $20 million more.】

item.title: 行业数据显示，特斯拉第二季度在加州的电动汽车注册量下降了 21
item.description: 行业数据显示，特斯拉第二季度在加利福尼亚州的电动汽车注册量下降了 21.1%，这表明埃隆-马斯克领导的汽车制造商在美国这一重要市场面临的挑战日益严峻。【原文：Tesla's electric vehicle registrations in California fell 21.1% in the second quarter, according to industry data, indicating growing challenges for the Elon Musk-led automaker in the crucial U.S. market.】

item.title: 特朗普称菲律宾将支付 19% 的关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周二表示，在与美国达成贸易协议后，菲律宾将支付 19% 的关税。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that the Philippines will pay a 19% tariff rate following the conclusion of a trade deal with the United States.】

item.title: 特朗普称美国考虑取消房屋销售资本利得税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周二表示，他的政府正在考虑取消房屋销售资本利得税。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday his administration is considering removing taxes on capital gains on home sales.】

item.title: 美国公司 CPS Energy 和 Modern Hydrogen 同意合作开展清洁发电项目
item.description: 总部位于得克萨斯州的公用事业公司 CPS Energy 周二表示，该公司与能源公司 Modern Hydrogen 就一个新项目达成了协议，以探索提高电网弹性和利用天然气进行清洁发电的潜力。【原文：Texas-based utility firm CPS Energy on Tuesday said it entered into an agreement with energy company Modern Hydrogen on a new project to explore the potential for increasing electricity grid resiliency and enabling cleaner power generation from natural gas.】

item.title: 美国国家公共电台（NPR）高级编辑伊迪丝-查平（Edith Chapin）将卸任
item.description: 美国国家公共广播电台（NPR）新闻机构周二表示，伊迪丝-查平（Edith Chapin）将于今年晚些时候辞去总编辑和代理首席内容官的职务。【原文：National Public Radio's (NPR) Edith Chapin will step down from her role as editor in chief and acting chief content officer later this year, the news outlet said on Tuesday, at a time when the broadcaster faces funding pressure after the Trump administration slashed public media subsidies.】

item.title: Soitec 第一季度销售额符合预期
item.description: 法国半导体材料供应商索泰克（Soitec）报告称，由于客户库存高企和汽车市场疲软，按固定汇率计算，其第一季度销售额下降了 16%。【原文：French semiconductor materials supplier Soitec reported a 16% drop at constant exchange rates in its first-quarter sales, due to high customer inventory and a weak automotive market.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，马斯克的 xAI 正在努力筹集高达 120 亿美元的资金
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周二援引熟悉情况的人士的话报道，埃隆-马斯克的人工智能初创公司xAI正在与一家金融公司合作，为其扩张计划再融资120亿美元。【原文：Elon Musk's artificial intelligence startup xAI is working with a financier to secure up to $12 billion more for its expansion plans, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称埃克森公司正与特立尼达谈判七个深水区块
item.description: 两位接近谈判的消息人士告诉路透社，埃克森美孚公司已开始与特立尼达和多巴哥政府谈判，在这个加勒比海国家东海岸的最多七个深水区块勘探石油和天然气。【原文：Exxon Mobil has begun negotiations with the Trinidad and Tobago government to explore for oil and gas in up to seven deepwater blocks off the East Coast of the Caribbean country, which the top U.S. oil producer left more than two decades ago, two sources close to the talks told Reuters.】

item.title: 好时、雀巢和其他可可公司驳回奴役儿童诉讼上诉
item.description: 周二，联邦上诉法院驳回了八名马里公民提出的集体诉讼，他们要求好时、雀巢和其他五家公司为象牙海岸可可农场的童工问题承担责任。【原文：A federal appeals court on Tuesday rejected a proposed class action by eight Malian citizens who sought to hold Hershey , Nestle and five other companies liable for child labor on Ivory Coast cocoa farms.】

item.title: 美墨航空争端有望在未来几天内解决
item.description: 墨西哥航空公司沃拉瑞斯（Volaris）首席执行官周二表示，该公司相信美国和墨西哥之间的航空争端可能在未来几天内得到解决。【原文：Mexican airline Volaris believes a resolution to a dispute between the U.S. and Mexico on aviation could arrive in the coming days, the carrier's CEO said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特朗普称美国将对来自菲律宾的商品征收 19% 的关税
item.description: 在菲律宾总统小费迪南德-马科斯（Ferdinand Marcos Jr.）对白宫进行了所谓的 "美丽访问 "之后，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周二宣布对来自菲律宾的商品征收19%的新关税，并称美国商品将支付零关税。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday announced a new 19% tariff rate for goods from the Philippines after what he called a "beautiful visit" by Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. to the White House, saying U.S. goods would pay zero tariffs.】

item.title: 育碧推出 "创意屋 "模式，第一季度预订额不及预期
item.description: 法国领先的电子游戏生产商育碧公司周二宣布对其内部结构进行全面重组，转而成立针对特定游戏类型的自主 "创意中心"，该公司公布的第一季度净预订额低于预期。【原文：France's lead videogame maker Ubisoft announced on Tuesday a sweeping reorganisation of its internal structure, shifting to autonomous "Creative Houses" tailored to specific gaming genres, as it reported first-quarter net bookings that fell short of expectations.】

item.title: 去风险情绪增加了对美国企业债券的需求
item.description: 随着美国股指接近历史新高，投资者开始降低股票投资组合的风险，购买更多的投资级公司债券，进而推动企业借贷成本在八个月内第二次达到 1998 年以来最紧张的水平。【原文：Investors have begun to de-risk their equity portfolios and buy more investment-grade corporate bonds as U.S. stock indices near new record highs, in turn pushing corporate borrowing costs to their tightest levels since 1998 for the second time in eight months.】

item.title: 特朗普称美联储鲍威尔将很快下台
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在周二的新闻发布会上表示，美国联邦储备委员会主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔将利率维持在过高水平，并将在八个月后卸任。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell kept rates too high and will be out in eight months, President Donald Trump said at a news conference on Tuesday.】

item.title: 耗资 75 亿美元的美国基础设施项目建成的电动汽车充电桩不足 400 个
item.description: 美国政府问责局（Government Accountability Office）周二表示，截至 4 月份，美国各州在 75 亿美元的联邦基础设施项目下建造的电动汽车充电桩还不到 400 个。【原文：U.S. states have built less than 400 electric vehicle charging ports through April under $7.5 billion federal infrastructure programs, the Government Accountability Office said Tuesday.】

item.title: 据《西雅图时报》报道，波音公司开始生产 777-8 型货机
item.description: 据《西雅图时报》周二报道，波音公司已开始生产其最新型货运飞机 777-8。【原文：Boeing has kicked off production of its newest freight carrier, the 777-8, the Seattle Times reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，苹果将避免每日罚款，欧盟将接受应用程序商店的变更
item.description: 直接了解此事的人士称，苹果公司对其应用程序商店规则和收费的修改很可能会获得欧盟反垄断监管机构的绿灯，此举将避免这家 iPhone 制造商可能面临的每日巨额罚款。【原文：Apple's changes to its App Store rules and fees will likely secure the green light from EU antitrust regulators, people with direct knowledge of the matter said, a move that would stave off potentially hefty daily fines for the iPhone maker.】

item.title: 哈里伯顿称墨西哥石油产出下降率将给业务重启带来压力
item.description: 美国油田服务供应商哈里伯顿公司周二表示，墨西哥原油产量的下降给重新启动业务带来了压力，因为国营的墨西哥石油公司（Pemex）长期拖延向其供应商付款。【原文：U.S. oilfield service provider Halliburton on Tuesday said Mexico's crude production decline rates are creating pressure for a reactivation of business amid long delays from state-run Pemex to pay its suppliers.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会称，PCAOB的长期官员将领导审计监督机构
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）已任命一位长期任职于上市公司会计监督委员会（Public Company Accounting Oversight Board）的官员领导该审计监督机构，此前该机构的负责人已于上周赶走了其民主党负责人。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has tapped a longtime official of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board to lead the audit watchdog, after the agency's head pushed out its Democratic chief last week.】

item.title: 德国汽车零部件制造商博世将裁员1,100人
item.description: 德国汽车零部件制造商博世公司一位高级官员周二表示，由于汽车市场急剧恶化导致销售下滑，博世将在2029年前裁员1100人，并重组其罗伊特林根工厂。【原文：German car parts maker Bosch will cut up to 1,100 jobs by 2029 and restructure its Reutlingen plant as a rapidly worsening auto market drives down sales, a senior company official said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 文件显示，白宫将公布将美国人工智能推向海外的计划，打击美国的人工智能规则
item.description: 路透社看到的一份文件显示，白宫周三打算公布一项计划，要求向国外出口美国的人工智能技术，并打击被认为对美国人工智能发展限制过多的州法律。【原文：The White House on Wednesday intends to publish a plan that calls for the export of American AI technology abroad and a crackdown on state laws deemed too restrictive to let American AI flourish, a document seen by Reuters shows.】
